forumNotes.author: doveman
forumNotes.content:
I'm looking to use the EWF filter on Window 7 (portable version by wimb [http://reboot.pro/to...to-make-mini-7/](http://reboot.pro/topic/18593-vhd-w7-compact-program-to-make-mini-7/ "") ) but I only seem to have a version suitable for XP.

I found these instructions [http://www.mp3car.co...ite-filter.html](http://www.mp3car.com/winnt-based/140081-ewf-on-windows-7-32-bit-or-64-bit-enhanced-write-filter.html "External link") and have extracted the required files from the ISO but as that thread is rather old, I thought I should check that it is still correct. I also found this EWF Manager [https://www.microsof...s.aspx?id=27587](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=27587 "External link") and wondered if I could use that to set it up, rather than finding out Disk Signatures and Partition Offsets and hand writing reg files?

forumNotes.author: Biatu
forumNotes.content:
There was a program i used that would automatically set the offsets and such.  
Additionally I used EWF on a full blown install, which worked great....until I ran out of RAM. No warnings, just BSOD.  
Even set up a service to run ewfmgr /commit on every boot...even before windows update started. but alot of updates wont work through ewf.  

I will see if I can find that application and i will get back with you.

forumNotes.author: Biatu
forumNotes.content:
Try these commands...  

ewfcfg.exe /install  
ewfcfg.exe /install-configuration

**Edited by Biatu, 18 October 2013 - 05:09 PM.**
